intro: Selago nigromontana, commonly known as the black mountain selago, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
